commitResults.messageTitle: Update UserGuide to clarify archive command functionalities
Update commands with active/archive description for clarity

commitResults.messageBody: Update UserGuide with Archive feature inconsistencies

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bugs not showing which list is displayed
Enable dynamic resizing for HelpWindow layout
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the HelpWindow layout used fixed heights
and lacked resizing support, which limited usability
on larger screens and made scrolling less fluid.

Let's update the layout to support dynamic resizing:
-Set `resizable="true"` on the root stage to allow
window resizing
-Apply `VBox.vgrow="ALWAYS"` to the TitledPane
so it expands with available vertical space
-Remove fixed height constraints on the ScrollPane
and inner components

These changes improve the responsiveness of
the UI and allow users to better view help content
regardless of screen size.

  Fix DG
  Edit images
  Fix puml diagram images
  Stop tracking .vscode folder
  Update missing elements of Developer Guide
  Add unarchive and togglearchive commands into UserGuide
  Fix diagrams and links in documentation
  updates DG
  Show available fields when none are specified
  fix validation to accept common domain endings
  fix validation to accept common domain endings

commitResults.messageBody: Fix documentation and error messages related to address

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify the example for add command in UG
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, if reader copied the command line by line instead of the
whole command together, he would have missed out on a whitespace between
the email and address prefix. Due to pdf saving, the wrapping to a
newline might have caused readers to miss out the whitespace

Modify the example to not wrap just before the address prefix

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix phrasing of UG for filter and find feature
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the phrasing of the UG caused the reader to have a
misconception in testing.

What we meant in the UG was the opposite of what the tester had though
of it as. Example: if there is a tenant with address in the app that has
"Kent", if the user type "filter Ken", the tenant will appear. What the
tester thought is that if the user type 'filter Kents', the tenant with
address "Kent" should appear.

Fixes #128

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor address filtering to support prefix matching with special chars
commitResults.messageBody:
The address filtering logic was refactored to support more flexible
prefix matching. Previously, special characters were removed from the
address, which caused issues with matching keywords like "pl" against
"place's".

Now, the filtering logic:
* Splits the address by whitespace and commas.
* Matches keywords as prefixes of any part of the address.
* Handles case-insensitive matching for better flexibility.

Additionally, a caution statement was added to the user guide to inform
users remove trailing commas when filtering a single keyword.

This update ensures that address filtering works more accurately with
special characters and partial matches, improving the filter
feature.

Fixes #131 (now works for addresses with special characters)
Fixes #139, #141, 143, #146 (filter command no longer shows all tenants
for special characters which were treated as wildcards)

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix Bug in DG whereby manual testing was unclear
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, readers had trouble identifying what the test case is meant
to test as it was vague regarding whether one of the tenants can have
"12345678" as a phone number.

Now, the commands 'add' 'paid' and 'unpaid' in the
'Appendix: Instructions for manual testing' specifies that the test case
fails because '12345678' is an invalid number.

This update ensures that readers are informed that the test cases with
'12345678' fails because '12345678' is an invalid number.

Fixes #151

Additionally, fix bug whereby the User Stories had wrong priorities
given to them.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix mismatch in filter feature specification between UG and DG
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, in the DG, the Filter Command is specified as being able to
filter tenants based on multiple fields such as address. However,
in the User Guide, the Filter Command is specified as only being able
to filter the list for tenants whose address contains any of the given
keywords, where Address is the only filterable field.

Now, the Filter Command in the DG is specified as being able to filter
tenants only based on their addresses.

Fixes #154

Edit the paid and unpaid feature description under the
'Newly Added Features' in the DG.

Fixes [PE-D][Tester A] Add Command Example in UG incorrect #157


Fix phrasing of UG for filter and find feature

Previously, the phrasing of the UG caused the reader to have a
misconception in testing.
What we meant in the UG was the opposite of what the tester had though
of it as.
Example: if there is a tenant with address in the app that has
"Kent", if the user type "filter Ken", the tenant will appear. What the
tester thought is that if the user type 'filter Kents', the tenant with
address "Kent" should appear.
Fixes [PE-D][Tester B] filter Command Fails to Match Prefixes as Described in User Guide #128


Refactor address filtering to support prefix matching with special chars

The address filtering logic was refactored to support more flexible
prefix matching. Previously, special characters were removed from the
address, which caused issues with matching keywords like "pl" against
"place's".
Now, the filtering logic:
Splits the address by whitespace and commas.
Matches keywords as prefixes of any part of the address.
Handles case-insensitive matching for better flexibility.
Additionally, a caution statement was added to the user guide to inform
users remove trailing commas when filtering a single keyword.
This update ensures that address filtering works more accurately with
special characters and partial matches, improving the filter
feature.
Fixes [PE-D][Tester A] Filter command does not work with addresses with special characters in Address Field #131 (now works for addresses with special characters)
Fixes [PE-D][Tester D] Filter command shows all tenants when keyword is single character "$" #139, [PE-D][Tester D] Filter command shows all tenants when keyword is single character "^" #141, 143, [PE-D][Tester D] Filter command shows all tenants when keyword is single character "+" #146 (filter command no longer shows all tenants
for special characters which were treated as wildcards)


Fix Bug in DG whereby manual testing was unclear

Previously, readers had trouble identifying what the test case is meant
to test as it was vague regarding whether one of the tenants can have
"12345678" as a phone number.
Now, the commands 'add' 'paid' and 'unpaid' in the
'Appendix: Instructions for manual testing' specifies that the test case
fails because '12345678' is an invalid number.
This update ensures that readers are informed that the test cases with
'12345678' fails because '12345678' is an invalid number.
-Fixes [PE-D][Tester D] Unclear prerequisite for manual testing of paid command #151
Additionally, fix bug whereby the User Stories had wrong priorities
given to them.


Fix mismatch in filter feature specification between UG and DG

Previously, in the DG, the Filter Command is specified as being able to
filter tenants based on multiple fields such as address. However, in the
User Guide, the Filter Command is specified as only being able
to filter the list for tenants whose address contains any of the given
keywords, where Address is the only filterable field.
Now, the Filter Command in the DG is specified as being able to filter
tenants only based on their addresses.
This ensures consistency between the UG and DG.
Fixes [PE-D][Tester A] Mismatch in command functionality specification between UG and DG #154
Additionally, edited the paid and unpaid feature description under the
'Newly Added Features' in the DG.
Update UG to address edit command bugs
Fix bugs not showing which list is displayed
